definition: small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women

sentences.english: Her mother taught her how to drink was the story before she was 16 years old.
sentences.chinese: 梁媽教閨女喝酒，是16歲之前的事。

sentences.english: As soon as your daughter’s hair was long enough, you put it in Leia buns.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你閨女的頭髮夠長了，你就給她紮起倆小圓髻。

sentences.english: Fat daughter comes to challenge, in a battle royal, miscarriage of white jade duckweed.
sentences.chinese: 胖閨女上門挑戰，一場混戰中，白玉萍小產了。

sentences.english: “You're welcome, old girl,” the vet said, shaking it.
sentences.chinese: “老閨女，不客氣，”獸醫握着爪子說道。

sentences.english: If maiden in your house, do you say this words again to attempt?
sentences.chinese: 要是你家閨女，你再說這話試試？

sentences.english: Mou Anne stomach Fei, your virgin still turns curved son to scold me not good-looking?
sentences.chinese: 牟安腹誹，你閨女還拐着彎子罵我不好看呢？

sentences.english: The two girls ran away and the youngest boy lives with him.
sentences.chinese: 兩個閨女跑了，那個最小的男孩兒和她丈夫一起過。

sentences.english: So the little girl was called "Little Red Coat" by her mother.
sentences.chinese: 從此，她媽媽管小閨女叫“小紅襖”。

sentences.english: Xu Chouzi's eldest daughter in casual grows into a big girl.
sentences.chinese: 徐醜子的大女兒在不經意間便出落成爲一個大閨女。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
erhua variant of 女孩[nu:3 hai2]
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
